intro: Viola grypoceras var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring heart-shaped, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. The plant produces small, delicate flowers in shades of purple or violet, usually with five petals and a distinctive yellow or orange center. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native gardens and ecological restoration projects.
